clinical_study.brief_title: Abdominal Muscle Thickness in Mechanically Ventilated Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Abdominal Muscle Thickness in Mechanically Ventilated Patients During Spontaneous Breathing Trials

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Socio Sanitaria Territoriale degli Spedali Civili di Brescia

clinical_study.source: Azienda Socio Sanitaria Territoriale degli Spedali Civili di Brescia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine to what extent the abdominal muscles contribute to airway pressure, in order to investigate the correlation between muscles weakness and extubation outcome in mechanically ventilated patients. In addition the reliability of the sonographic measurements will be assessed.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine to what extent the abdominal muscles contribute to airway pressure, in order to investigate the correlation between muscles weakness and extubation outcome in mechanically ventilated patients. In addition the reliability of the sonographic measurements will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between thickening fraction and SBT outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed before SBT
primary_outcome.description: Correlation between thickening fraction of each muscles evaluated by ultrasound before the SBT and the SBT outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between the pressures generated by respiratory muscles and SBT outcome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed before SBT
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between the pressures generated by respiratory muscles during the ultrasound measurements (Twice Transdiaphragmatic pressure, TwPdi; maximal inspiratory pressure, MIP) and SBT outcome

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed before SBT
secondary_outcome.description: Concordance of measurements of abdominal muscle thickness and thickening fraction in mechanically ventilated patients performed by two different observers will be evaluated.

intervention.description: Abdominal muscles ultrasound during a spontaneous breathing trial using the M-mode to calculate the thickening fraction of the anterior and lateral abdominal muscles under multiple circumstances (tasks performed by the patients)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- greater than 18 years old
- Patients requiring invasive mechanical ventilation including patients with endotracheal tube and tracheotomies
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a previously diagnosed neuromuscular disorder (acute or chronic)
- Behavioural agitation
- Patients who are not awake and cooperative
- Previously enrolled in the study
